channel.title: Torture in the USA
channel.description: By torture, I mean things made more painful, really, "just for the hell of it." Particularly, catheters. I was exposed to a catheter recently when I passively refused to submit to a drug test. The result? I went through more pain than I can imagine. Luckily, I was on diphenhydramine at the time and can't remember much of it, but this I say: many things could easily be made less painful, yet, because of reasons unknown to me, people do not see the use of this. On a side note, has anyone else here been cathetered? On a second side note, I still can't pee without large amounts of pain. Please, someone fill me in on why I wasn't given some sort of numbing agent prior to being cathetered if there really is a good reason behind it.

item.title: Torture in the USA
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Mopman:

Yes, it goes down the inside of the penis.

Wow, fuck that. =\

item.title: Torture in the USA
item.dc:creator: @DeadBird DeadBird
item.description:
@DeadBird wrote:

ot: I’ve had a catheter before, but for a surgery. I had it removed because it hurt like hell. I didn’t “heal” until like 2 weeks later. I’m really hoping they give me a choice next go around…

Read full topic

item.title: Torture in the USA
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

You shouldn’t need a numbing agent before using a catheter, people use those every day, i doubt they numb their John Craven every time!

However, I can quite see them making it more painful because you were being stubborn. Sad fact of life, you pissed them off, they’ll hurt you while making it look accidental.

Read full topic
